attributes.albumName: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band

attributes.name: 1 (2015 Version)
attributes.copyright: ? 2015 Calderstone Productions Limited (a division of Universal Music Group) / Apple Corps Ltd.

editorialNotes.standard: The Beatles' 1 was originally released in 2000 and quickly became the fastest-selling album of all time. Featuring 27 of the band's most significant singles-all of which reached No. 1 in the U.S. or U.K. charts-this updated edition now features brand-new stereo mixes by Giles Martin and Sam Okell at Abbey Road Studios.
editorialNotes.short: The fastest-selling album of all time-updated with new stereo mixes.

attributes.name: The Beatles 1967-1970 (The Blue Album)
attributes.copyright: ? Digital Remaster 2010 The copyright in this compilation is owned by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: Released just three years after the band's official break-up,
put The Beatles' later-year tracks into one package (released simultaneously with

) featuring key songs from the group's albums as well as stand-alone singles. With music that signified the group's own development as well as the culture around them, this selection of material from albums such as Sgt. Pepper and Abbey Road contains some of their most radical studio experiments and most loved songs.
editorialNotes.short: Some of their most radical studio experiments and most loved songs.

attributes.name: Revolver
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: Revolver is The Beatles at their peak of creativity. Surprising shifts in mood prevail on this album -ranging from the bright positivity of "Good Day Sunshine" to the paranoia of "She Said She Said." The balance of pure harmony ("Here, There and Everywhere") with jangling electric guitar ("And Your Bird Can Sing"), orchestral character portraits ("Eleanor Rigby") and brassy soul ("Got to Get You Into My Life") is seamless. Revolver is also one of the first psychedelic albums-with backwards guitar, sitar, sound effects, and complex lyrics throughout-culminating in the mystical finale of "Tomorrow Never Knows." Filled with revolutionary studio advances and perfect song craft, the end result is a towering artistic achievement.
editorialNotes.short: Their creative peak, filled with revolutionary studio advances and perfect songcraft.

attributes.name: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: The Sgt. Pepper album was recorded in a four-month span beginning in 1966. The advent of new studio techniques such as multitrack recording and pitch shifting (recording tracks at different speeds) as well as the band's increasingly diverse influences led to the LP's kaleidoscope of sound experiments (music hall, Western and Eastern classical, rock 'n' roll). The album, from the pop-art packaging to the gapless track sequencing, successfully put forth the idea that music and art were synonymous.
editorialNotes.short: Art and music combine for one of the 20th century's defining albums.

attributes.name: The Beatles 1962-1966 (The Red Album)
attributes.copyright: ? Digital Remaster 2010 The copyright in this compilation is owned by EMI             Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: The 1973 collection known to fans as "The Red Album" (released simultaneously with "The Blue Album") follows the band from their debut up until the release of Revolver. From the Beatlemania that brought them worldwide popularity to the bold experimentation of their mid-period, this is an essential overview of the band's rapid ascent as musical adventurers.
editorialNotes.short: The band's rapid ascent as musical adventurers.

attributes.name: Abbey Road
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: Abbey Road uses a "less is more" approach to production throughout, giving "Come Together" a controlled intensity while the raw sound of Paul's voice on "Oh! Darling" is one of the album's highlights. The sound of a whole band working together flawlessly is heard most notably in the 8-title dramatic medley that made up the second side of the vinyl; finishing fittingly with
editorialNotes.short: The sound of the whole band working together flawlessly with a less-is-more approach.

attributes.name: The Beatles (White Album)
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: Beneath the white-on-white cover art,

is an eclectic, 30-track album of largely stripped-down material, originally spread across two vinyl records. The album was a stark contrast to Sgt. Pepper in every aspect - from the cover art to the sounds within. The sheer breadth of material as well as the mixture of the loud and the soft is part of what makes
so surprising. The heavy sounds of
and
juxtapose with the gentle beauty of
and
. The cacophony of
is followed by the orchestral lullaby of
. The album's extended length gave the band room in which they could explore all of their musical influences and multiple forms of popular music, while creating revolutionary sounds in the studio.
editorialNotes.short: An eclectic 30-track album with a stunning breadth of material and dynamic songs.

attributes.name: Rubber Soul
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: Rubber Soul marked a new period of development for The Beatles, illustrated by the sitar leads on "Norwegian Wood," the harpsichord effect on "In My Life," and Lennon's character portrait of "Nowhere Man." It exhibits not only a love for R&B, but also for the burgeoning folk-rock scene and exploding counter-culture. By 1965, the band was spending longer hours at the studio as both a refuge from the increasingly excitable outside world and as a place where their imaginations could flourish. As a result, Rubber Soul is a culmination of great depth, focus, and sophistication to create a startlingly original album.
editorialNotes.short: In a huge artistic leap, they embraced R&B, folk-rock, and counter-culture rebellion.

attributes.name: Magical Mystery Tour
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned            by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: The sessions for the Magical Mystery Tour songs continued the experimentation that defined Sgt. Pepper. Fantastically surreal on "I Am the Walrus" and sweetly anthemic on "All You Need Is Love," Magical Mystery Tour is the band at its psychedelic peak. Originally released as a double EP to accompany the televised film of the same name, Magical Mystery Tour was expanded into a full-length album with the addition of single-only tracks such as "Strawberry Fields Forever" and "Penny Lane."
editorialNotes.short: The sessions for this album continued the experimentation that defined Sgt. Pepper.

attributes.name: Help!
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: The group's second foray into feature films produced exceptional new music on this soundtrack album. Help!, which includes
, and

, mingles tracks featured in the film with groundbreaking original songs. With the release of this album, The Beatles brought a wide array of instrumentation (woodwinds, electric piano, tambourine) and orchestration to a pop album. The immediacy of their songwriting, their jangling riffs and their charismatic vocals helped to usher in the sound of the '60s.
editorialNotes.short: Their second film offered brilliant new music that shaped the sound of the `60s.

attributes.name: A Hard Day's Night
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: A Hard Day's Night was both a soundtrack to the dazzling Richard Lester-directed film and a triumphant album unto itself. It was the first album to contain only music written by John Lennon and Paul McCartney as well as the band's first foray into four-track recording. A Hard Day's Night offers up a multitude of different sounds (bongos, harmonica, double-tracked vocals, cowbells) included on vibrant tracks such as the title tune and
as well as thoughtful melodies like
. A Hard Day's Night is full of youthful optimism, but The Beatles show a remarkable maturity in their songwriting and arranging on tracks like
and
editorialNotes.short: Both a soundtrack and triumphant album-and the first of Lennon/McCartney originals.

attributes.name: Please Please Me
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: From the opening chords of "I Saw Her Standing There" to "Twist and Shout," The Beatles' debut highlights the group's live energy and songwriting strength. Recorded, edited, and mixed in just over 25 hours, the mood of the album is raw and exuberant. The explosive sound of Please Please Me, with its frequent yelps and handclaps, as well as the unusual selection of American songs they chose to cover on the album, emulates the energy of their early R&B and rock 'n' roll influences.
editorialNotes.short: The Beatles' exuberant debut highlights their live energy and songwriting strength.

attributes.name: Let It Be
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned            by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: The group's final studio release was actually recorded before Abbey Road, but was set aside and then released a few weeks after the band's decision to split had been made official. Here, the group worked on recording with no studio effects or overdubbing of additional instruments or vocals. Their intention was to perform the songs live and capture them directly on tape. This approach provides soulful urgency in
and
(both aired during the band's final rooftop concert). The album also unearths some of The Beatles' rock 'n' roll roots with tracks such as
and
. Famed producer Phil Spector was eventually brought in, adding his own signature layers of sound to several songs, including two of the band's most popular ballads - the title track and
editorialNotes.short: This 1970 album mixes soulful urgency with the raw energy of their rock 'n' roll roots.

attributes.name: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band (Deluxe Edition)
attributes.copyright: ? 2017 Calderstone Productions Limited (a Division of Universal Music Group) / Apple Corps Limited

editorialNotes.standard: Sgt. Pepper's was recorded in a four-month span beginning in 1966. The advent of new studio techniques such as multitrack recording and pitch shifting (recording tracks at different speeds) as well as the band's increasingly diverse influences led to the LP's kaleidoscope of sound experiments (music hall, Western and Eastern classical, rock 'n' roll). The album, from the pop-art packaging to the gapless track sequencing, successfully put forth the idea that music and art were synonymous. This deluxe set features alternate takes, new mixes, reprises, speeches, instrumentals, and other curiosities.
editorialNotes.short: Fifty years later, the classic LP with alternate takes and new mixes.

attributes.name: Love
attributes.copyright: ? 2011 The copyright in this sound recording is owned by EMI Records Ltd/Apple Corps Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: Part soundtrack to the Cirque du Soleil show of the same name and part remix album, The Beatles' LOVE is a detailed and exhilarating look at the band's entire catalogue. Producers George Martin and his son Giles worked with the entire archive of multitrack recordings to create a soundscape of new, yet recognizable, music for the Las Vegas show. For example: the guitars from
are blended into
while
transitions, using elements of
and
, into
. The GRAMMYr Award-winning album is a sonic tapestry that allows you to discover new sounds within one of the most celebrated catalogues of music. Get LOVE with two exclusive bonus tracks (
), and iTunes LP featuring album artwork and more.
editorialNotes.short: A detailed and exhilarating look at the band's entire catalogue.

attributes.name: Beatles For Sale
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: Following A Hard Day's Night and a globe-trotting tour, Beatles For Sale debuted in 1964. The band's fourth album touches on two sides of the band's personality. The Beatles were exploring new musical and lyrical ideas as heard in the folk rock-tinged, poetic lyrics of
and
. John Lennon provided a mixture of melancholy and melody on the opening tracks
and
. On the flip side, they were still knocking out fiery renditions of their favourite rock 'n' roll classics, such as
and
editorialNotes.short: Showcasing both sides of their personality, exploring new musical and lyrical ideas.

attributes.name: With The Beatles
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned            by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: Just four whirlwind months after their 1963 debut, Please Please Me, The Beatles released their second album, With The Beatles. Known in the press at the time as

, The Beatles generated unbridled excitement everywhere; in their concerts, radio and TV appearances and in the entire pop scene both in the UK and abroad. With The Beatles is an instant rush, opening with John singing the first line of
and the group immediately responds with an enthusiastic

. This energy keeps pace throughout the entire album; songs seem to be played at twice the normal speed. The band's first album announced the band's arrival, their second album brought the sound to the world and changed the pop landscape.
editorialNotes.short: The group's second album brought their sound to the world and changed pop music.

attributes.name: Past Masters, Vols. 1 & 2
attributes.copyright: ? Digital Remaster 2009 The copyright in this compilation is owned by EMI             Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: Past Masters, Vols. 1 & 2, originally released in 1988, gathered all of The Beatles' songs (some of their best known) that weren't included on the original UK albums. The two collections are available as one here and contain songs from their earliest days (
), their psychedelic era (
), and their final sessions together as a band (
, and
). The Beatles put as much work into their singles as they did on their albums as proven in this collection.
editorialNotes.short: All the songs that weren't included on the original UK albums.

attributes.name: Yellow Submarine
attributes.copyright: ? 2009 The copyright in this audio & audiovisual compilation is owned by EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: Half of this album contains George Martin's lush score for the animated film, and the other half contains the title track (originally released on Revolver) as well as two Eastern-tinged George Harrison numbers (
and
). Lennon's rumbling
and the infectious
also add colourful touches that fit in with the animated film's enduring legacy.
editorialNotes.short: This album combines George Martin's lush film score and brilliant original songs.

attributes.name: Anthology 3
attributes.copyright: ? Digital Remaster  2011 The copyright in this compilation is owned by Apple Corps Ltd/EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: The many diverse and brilliant ideas that went into the band's final two years are chronicled in Anthology 3. Here, you'll find the song sketches recorded at George Harrison's house after the group's trip to India. Many of these became the songs so well known on
and Abbey Road. From Abbey Road Studios to the band's offices on Savile Row, the musical insights come fast and furious on soulful versions of
and
. Additionally, you'll find music from the band's legendary final rooftop concert and other songs that would appear in later solo efforts (
editorialNotes.short: The many diverse and brilliant ideas that went into the band's final two years.

attributes.name: Anthology 2
attributes.copyright: ? Digital Remaster  2011 The copyright in this compilation is owned by Apple Corps Ltd/EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: With alternate versions, studio outtakes, live cuts, and demo versions of material from 1965 up until 1968, Anthology 2 shows the band crafting some of the best-loved music of their career. This collection explores how strong the band's material was at its core (listen to the largely acoustic
) or just how inventive they could be without those telltale harmonies (try one of the alternate versions of
). Also included in Anthology 2 is
one of John Lennon's last demos, given life thanks to a reworking by Paul McCartney, George Harrison, and Ringo Starr.
editorialNotes.short: Alternate versions, outtakes, live cuts and demos from 1965 up until 1968.

attributes.name: Anthology 1
attributes.copyright: ? Digital Remaster  2011 The copyright in this compilation is owned by Apple Corps Ltd/EMI Records Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: From rare recordings with Stuart Sutcliffe and Pete Best in their short time with The Beatles to the band fine-tuning their live skills from Hamburg to Sweden, the first in the Anthology series is filled with historic milestones and incredible music. Anthology 1 leads off with

, originally a demo recorded by John Lennon in 1977 and reworked by George Harrison, Ringo Starr and Paul McCartney in 1994. From there, this collection chronicles the band's fiery, R&B-fueled years from 1958 through 1964 and features previously unreleased recordings, live versions, alternate takes and interview snippets of the band as they began to set the world aflame.
editorialNotes.short: Filled with historic milestones and incredible music.

attributes.name: Live at the Hollywood Bowl
attributes.copyright: ? 2016 Calderstone Productions Limited (a division of Universal Music Group) / Apple Corps Ltd.

editorialNotes.short: An electric companion to Ron Howard's documentary.

attributes.name: Let It Be... Naked
attributes.copyright: ? Digital Remaster  2013 The copyright in this sound recording is owned by Apple Corps Limited/Calderstone Productions Limited (a division of Universal Music Group)

editorialNotes.standard: Let It Be was intended to be a return to fundamentals-just four musicians playing live in the studio. But creative fractures eventually led The Beatles to scuttle the month-long sessions and Let It Be only saw the light of day after being reassembled by Phil Spector (famed for his elaborate

aesthetic). Let It Be. Naked is, at long last, a realisation of the band's original vision. Overseen by Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr and remastered from the original tapes, these performances offer the warmth and intimacy of the sessions with no added flourishes.
editorialNotes.short: A realisation of the band's original vision, remastered from the original tapes.

attributes.name: The Beatles Bootleg Recordings 1963
attributes.copyright: ? 2013 The copyright in these sound recordings is owned by Calderstone Productions Limited (a division of Universal Music Group).

editorialNotes.standard: With more than two hours of previously unreleased material, The Beatles Bootleg Recordings 1963 tells the story of the band during a period of remarkable transformation: a year that begins with the Liverpool quartet working out arrangements during the Please Please Me sessions and culminates in the BBC Radio sessions. With subtly different lyrical phrasing and instrumental performances, the 15 alternative studio versions of tunes like
and
are deeply rewarding, as is the richly harmonised pop standard
. But, the 42 live performances for the BBC underscore the transition from local stars to the peak of Beatlemania in Britain. They respond to a call-in request with a crackling version of
, burn through a cover of Chuck Berry's
and offer a bright, up-tempo reading of
. This compilation is rounded out by two demos of songs the group never released: the mid-tempo
and the lovely, piano-accompanied closer,
editorialNotes.short: More than two hours of previously unreleased material.

description.standard: As The Beatles, the quartet of John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison, and Ringo Starr forever changed the face of pop music. Shortly after the group's lineup solidified in 1961, a series of wildly successful singles made them superstars, and in the mid-'60s Beatlemania swept the globe. The rest of the decade was defined by fearless experimentation, musical reinvention, and visionary recordings. Years after their 1970 breakup, The Beatles continue to be a keystone influence on countless artists. This selection of unforgettable songs offers an introduction to the band's towering legacy for new listeners, and an opportunity for longtime fans to fall in love with them all over again.
description.short: John. Paul. George. Ringo. Get acquainted with the world's most influential band.

description.standard: The Beatles were such pop perfectionists that nearly everything they touched turned to gold; even the lesser-known gems of their catalog bested many bands' biggest songs. Dive into the b-sides of their hits-packed affairs with this playlist.
description.short: Nearly everything they touched turned to gold.

description.standard: In the beginning, The Beatles became superstars on the strength of world-conquering singles like
and

-songs that captured the wide-eyed innocence of young love. But as¬†their career progressed, they evolved into master craftsmen capable of re-articulating matters of the heart in all their crushing nuance and complexity. This playlist is a collection of their best.¬†
description.short: Fall head over heels with the lads from Liverpool.

description.standard: Underneath all that pop perfection, The Beatles boast an emotional range that is nothing short of sweeping. They could be blissful, dour, even downright ferocious. The clanging
boasts one of John Lennon's angriest vocals, while on the flipside, George Harrison's acoustic demo of
proves more delicate than its electric counterpart.
description.short: From the edges of their emotional and musical range.

description.standard: Even after they broke up, The Beatles' fingerprints could be found all over pop. That's George Harrison's sweet and soaring slide refrain on Badfinger's yearning
John Lennon's clucking guitar and falsetto vocals on David Bowie's disco-tinged
and Paul McCartney's walking bassline and unmistakable melodic phrasing on the bouncy
his co-write with Elvis Costello.
description.short: Their collaborative fingerprints grace pop that yearns and soars.

description.standard: They were rock 'n' roll's biggest band, and probably always will be-so it's only natural that a staggering number of artists have covered the Fab Four. Need a primer? We've hand-selected our favorites from every genre for this playlist, including Ella Fitzgerald, Siouxsie & The Banshees, Joe Cocker, Johnny Cash, and The Black Keys.
description.short: Getting by with a little help from their friends.

description.standard: The Beatles are inescapable. Just about every pop musician of the past half-century has been influenced by them to some extent. From '60s contemporaries like The Who and The Monkees through to '70s acolytes Big Star and ELO to indie landmarks like XTC and Elliott Smith, this is just a sample of how thoroughly John, Paul, George and Ringo changed everything.
description.short: Scratching the surface of the Fab Four's influence.

description.standard: Throughout their career, The Beatles expressed their love of R&B with heart-on-sleeve enthusiasm, infusing their songwriting with the rhythms and harmonies of Motown and Stax. It was an influence that inspired the band until their final days, when keyboardist Billy Preston added soulful depth to the
sessions. This explosive set brings together the group's R&B-influenced favorites.
description.short: Hear the Fab Four channel their musical heroes.¬†

description.standard: Many of The Beatles' finest pop songs combine memorable characters with masterful storytelling. A beautifully baroque backing and evocative description of place create a nostalgic reverie in
while protagonists both cartoonish (
) and tragic (
) come to life via sing-along melodies and haunting orchestration, respectively.
description.short: Pop graced with memorable characters and masterful storytelling.

description.standard: A legacy of endless musical innovation-including Ringo Starr's surprisingly funky drum licks-has drawn artists to The Beatles since the early days of sampling. Dozens of acts, from A Tribe Called Quest to Sublime to The Roots to Animal Collective, have recycled riffs from rock's most famous band. Press play and listen for bits and pieces of the Fab Four. And while you're at it, pay special attention to "The Sounds of Science" by The Beastie Boys: the dizzying mash-up of multiple Beatles samples is wickedly clever.
description.short: A patchwork of songs that samples from the Fab Four.

description.standard: The Beatles weren't just pop's greatest group; they were also pioneers who experimented with novel ways to release and promote music. The film clips they released in the '60s are some of the earliest examples of pop music videos. Whether it's John mugging for the camera (
), Paul giggling at the mic (
), or the whole group larking about with an exploded piano (
), watching the palpable chemistry between all four is an infectious joy.
description.short: Pop's greatest group share an infectious visual chemistry.

description.standard: Chris is a musicologist, producer and conduit. He has spent the greater part of the last 7 years touring the world with Sir Paul McCartney as his show opening DJ. Chris has remixed The Beatles, David Bowie, and Radiohead among others and has produced events for Rolling Stone Magazine, NPR, AMC, VICE and Comedy Central. We doubt he sleeps much.

attributes.name: Chris Holmes Compiles His Favorite Beatles Covers

editorialNotes.short: Watch magical visuals dance to a string-kissed version of the stunning ballad.
This groundbreaking video imagines a world within the song.

editorialNotes.standard: This video captures the intense energy of Beatlemania.
editorialNotes.short: This video captures the intense energy of Beatlemania.
